problem_text:
9.3. Counterexample in the water-wave problem for a submerged body
Let us use the geometrical assumptions made in Section 48. The boundary value problem of harmonic oscillations of the ﬂuid induced by a submerged body is stated as follows. The function u satisﬁes (9.1), (9.3), while (9.2) is replaced by

∂u/∂y − ν u = 0  for y = 0

and a radiation condition at inﬁnity is required (see [38]).

In [64] a class of domains is found for which the problem in question is uniquely solvable for all ν > 0, see also [38, Chapter 1].

Problem. Construct an example of a connected set Ω showing that some restrictions on Ω ensuring solvability are necessary.
